content.webTitle: The Thames whale exhibition - how to book tickets

fields.headline: The Thames whale exhibition - how to book tickets
fields.bodyText: Get free tickets to see the skeleton of the Thames whale. It goes on display for the first time in the Guardian's Newsroom exhibition space for one week only from January 22. The exhibition, organised in conjunction with the Natural History Museum, tells the story of the whale's journey and its attempted rescue. Monday January 22 to Saturday January 27 Monday - Wednesday and Friday 10am - 5pm Thursday 10am - 9pm Saturday 10am - 4pm To book tickets call: 020 7239 9993 Lines open 10am to 6pm Monday to Friday, January 15 to January 26 Entrance to the event is free but strictly by booked time slot only. You must bring along a front page of the Guardian with your booking confirmation to gain entry to the exhibition. Newsroom, the Guardian and Observer Archive and Visitor Centre 60 Farringdon Rd London EC1 Terms and conditions: 1. Tickets to the exhibition are limited and will be issued on a first come, first served basis only. 2. Entrance to the exhibition is on the hour, latecomers will not be admitted. 3. Maximum of six tickets per person. 4. Only one front page of the Guardian required per party of up to six people.
